t: Luke 12
Beware of Hypocrisy

In*p the meantime, when an innumerable multitude of people had gathered together, so that they trampled one another, He began to say to His disciples first of*i all,*i “Beware*r of*r the*r leaven*r of*r the*r Pharisees,*r which*r is*r hypocrisy.*r
For*r there*r is*r nothing*r covered*r that*r will*r not*r be*r revealed,*r nor*r hidden*r that*r will*r not*r be*r known.*r

Therefore*r whatever*r you*r have*r spoken*r in*r the*r dark*r will*r be*r heard*r in*r the*r light,*r and*r what*r you*r have*r spoken*r in*r the*r ear*r in*r inner*r rooms*r will*r be*r proclaimed*r on*r the*r housetops.*r

But*r the*r very*r hairs*r of*r your*r head*r are*r all*r numbered.*r Do*r not*r fear*r therefore;*r you*r are*r of*r more*r value*r than*r many*r sparrows.*r

The Parable of the Rich Fool
Then*p one from the crowd said to Him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”
But*p He said to him, “Man,*r who*r made*r Me*r a*r judge*r or*r an*r arbitrator*r over*r you?”*r
And He said to them, “Take*r heed*r and*r beware*r of*r covetousness,*r for*r one’s*r life*r does*r not*r consist*r in*r the*r abundance*r of*r the*r things*r he*r possesses.”*r
Then*p He spoke a parable to them, saying: “The*r ground*r of*r a*r certain*r rich*r man*r yielded*r plentifully.*r
And*r he*r thought*r within*r himself,*r saying,*r ‘What*r shall*r I*r do,*r since*r I*r have*r no*r room*r to*r store*r my*r crops?’*r
So*r he*r said,*r ‘I*r will*r do*r this:*r I*r will*r pull*r down*r my*r barns*r and*r build*r greater,*r and*r there*r I*r will*r store*r all*r my*r crops*r and*r my*r goods.*r
And*r I*r will*r say*r to*r my*r soul,*r “Soul,*r you*r have*r many*r goods*r laid*r up*r for*r many*r years;*r take*r your*r ease;*r eat,*r drink,*r and*ir be*r merry.”’*r
But*r God*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Fool!*r This*r night*r your*r soul*r will*r be*r required*r of*r you;*r then*r whose*r will*r those*r things*r be*r which*r you*r have*r provided?’*r
“So*rp is*ir he*r who*r lays*r up*r treasure*r for*r himself,*r and*r is*r not*r rich*r toward*r God.”*r
Do Not Worry
Then*p He said to His disciples, “Therefore*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r do*r not*r worry*r about*r your*r life,*r what*r you*r will*r eat;*r nor*r about*r the*r body,*r what*r you*r will*r put*r on.*r
Life*r is*r more*r than*r food,*r and*r the*r body*r is*ir more*ir than*r clothing.*r

For*r all*r these*r things*r the*r nations*r of*r the*r world*r seek*r after,*r and*r your*r Father*r knows*r that*r you*r need*r these*r things.*r
But*r seek*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God,*r and*r all*r these*r things*r shall*r be*r added*r to*r you.*r
“Do*rp not*r fear,*r little*r flock,*r for*r it*r is*r your*r Father’s*r good*r pleasure*r to*r give*r you*r the*r kingdom.*r

The Faithful Servant and the Evil Servant
“Let*rp your*r waist*r be*r girded*r and*r your*ir lamps*r burning;*r

and*r you*r yourselves*r be*r like*r men*r who*r wait*r for*r their*r master,*r when*r he*r will*r return*r from*r the*r wedding,*r that*r when*r he*r comes*r and*r knocks*r they*r may*r open*r to*r him*r immediately.*r

And*r if*r he*r should*r come*r in*r the*r second*r watch,*r or*r come*r in*r the*r third*r watch,*r and*r find*r them*ir so,*r blessed*r are*r those*r servants.*r

Discern the Time
